attributes.action: Amend current Bankruptcy legislation to protect assets of third parties and to limit Trustees fees.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Where a person involved in a relationship goes into bankruptcy, property that is, on paper, jointly or individually owned can be taken. If it can be proven beyond reasonable doubt that an asset has been paid for by the solvent partner then the Trustee should have no claim on it. It is further petitioned that Trustees fees should be limited by law to a proportion of the indebtedness thereby allowing the bankrupt to clear his/her indebtedness to the benefit of his/her creditors.
